page.title: 20RECREATION
page.content: Although a small farming community the area has a number of recreational clubs which cater for various age groups. There is a snooker club and a football club, both of which play in local leagues. Based on the Village Hall in Woodseaves are the Youth Club, the Darby & Joan Club, and the Womens' Institute. Whist drives are held every fortnight in the Village Hall. There is also a Brownie pack. A piece of land has recently been acquired which belongs to the School in Dickys Lane,Woodseaves.The land is rented by the Parish Council from the County Council for a nominal amount and is used as a playing field for organised and casual games. Local pubs run darts and domino teams and one pub runs a Horticultural Club,the garden produce being sold every week,the money going to charity.
